net.peierls.puzzle

Interface PuzzleState<T extends PuzzleState<T>>


  • public interface PuzzleState<T extends PuzzleState<T>>
    A representation of the state of a puzzle that involves finding a sequence of moves from an initial state to a solution state.
    • A state can stream its successors, which are the states resulting in a single move from it.
    • A puzzle state can report whether it is a solution state or whether it is "hopeless", meaning that no sequence of moves from it will result in a solution state.
    • A puzzle state knows its predecessor state, and this information is not required to be used in defining state equivalence, i.e., two states with different predecessors are permitted to compare as equal.
    • There is no separate puzzle type, because an initial puzzle state instance essentially defines the puzzle: Find a sequence of states starting with the initial state and ending with a solution state with each element of the sequence other than first being a successor of the previous element of the sequence.
    • A puzzle state may be initialized with precomputed values through the precomputed() method. This allows solvers to avoid unnecessary expensive computation on states that have already been seen. It is permissible to return self from this method if precautions for mutability under concurrent access are taken, e.g., if the state type is immutable and no precomputation is needed.
    • A puzzle state type may optionally define a funnel, which if it exists can be used to produce a (potentially) lossy encoding of states of that type for use in approximate containment tests.
    • A puzzle state can produce a solution, i.e., a list of states from some initial state to the current state, where each element other than the first is a successor to the previous state in the list. The current state is not required to be a solution state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Optional<com.google.common.hash.Funnel<T>> funnel()
      Optionally returns a funnel for encoding arbitrary instances of this type, for use in approximate containment tests.
      boolean isHopeless()
      Returns true if it is known that no solution state can be reached from this state.
      boolean isSolution()
      Returns whether this is a solution state.
      default T precomputed()
      Returns a state that is equivalent to this state, but which might implement some methods more efficiently, e.g., by precomputing commonly needed values.
      default Optional<T> predecessor()
      The state from which this state was reached.
      default int score()
      A rating of how good this state is.
      Stream<T> successors()
      The stream of puzzle states obtainable by a single move from this state.
      default List<T> toSolution()
      Convert this state into a solution.

    • Method Detail

      • isSolution

        boolean isSolution()
        Returns whether this is a solution state.

      • isHopeless

        boolean isHopeless()
        Returns true if it is known that no solution state can be reached from this state. Returns false otherwise, i.e., if it is not known that no solution state can be reached from this state, or if it is known that a solution state can be reached from this state.

      • successors

        Stream<T> successors()
        The stream of puzzle states obtainable by a single move from this state.

      • predecessor

        default Optional<T> predecessor()
        The state from which this state was reached.

      • precomputed

        default T precomputed()
        Returns a state that is equivalent to this state, but which might implement some methods more efficiently, e.g., by precomputing commonly needed values. The return value can be this instance itself, and that is how the method is implemented by default.

      • score

        default int score()
        A rating of how good this state is. Lower is better. You can return the same value for all states if you don't know. This value is currently ignored by the framework.

      • funnel

        default Optional<com.google.common.hash.Funnel<T>> funnel()
        Optionally returns a funnel for encoding arbitrary instances of this type, for use in approximate containment tests.

      • toSolution

        default List<T> toSolution()
        Convert this state into a solution.
